intro: Valeriana udicola, commonly known as the swamp valerian, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in Central and South America. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, often pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and is often found in marshes and along streams. Valeriana udicola has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in the summer. It is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
